medical_history.chief_complaint: Refractory, hypertrophic lesions on the plantarsurfaces of both feet causing severe pain and swelling.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a 10-year history of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and severe discoid lupus erythematosus (DLE). Symptoms of plantar lesions began recently and were associated with significant pain and swelling, making it difficult for the patient to walk. Previous treatments had resulted in either no improvement or only transient, mild improvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history significant for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), extensive discoid lupus erythematosus (DLE), seizures, severe polyarthritis, acute tubular necrosis, recurrent thrombocytopenia caused by SLE, avascular necrosis of multiple joints caused by corticosteroid therapy, and lung adenocarcinoma for which she underwent right upper lobectomy.
medical_history.social_history: History of smoking but had quit several years before presentation.
